blocks.html: Legal timeline

items.title: Primary diagnosis — T‑lymphoblasts (lymphoma); staging
items.summary: Initial workup confirmed lymphoma with T‑lymphoblastic features; baseline tests and staging completed.
items.details: Hematology consult, imaging and biopsies established the diagnosis and stage. Baseline cardiac and lab assessment recorded before therapy.

items.title: Chemotherapy against lymphoma (T‑lymphoblastic)
items.summary: Systemic chemotherapy with supportive care; adjuvant radiation therapy.
items.details: Planned cycles with interim response checks and end‑of‑treatment assessment. Radiotherapy delivered for consolidation: ~30 sessions.

items.title: Relapse — T‑lymphoblastic lymphoma (diagnosis)
items.summary: Relapse confirmed; treatment plan renewed.
items.details: Diagnostic reassessment reconfirmed T‑lymphoblastic lymphoma; systemic therapy restart indicated.

items.title: Chemotherapy with adjunct radiotherapy ×30; massive GI bleed with MI
items.summary: Chemo resumed with radiotherapy; GI ulcer bleed led to myocardial infarction; therapy continued after stabilization.
items.details: Severe anemia and tachyarrhythmia managed with transfusions and critical care. Radiotherapy delivered alongside chemotherapy: ~30 sessions.

items.title: Aggressive leukemia with extreme leukocytosis — diagnosis
items.summary: Leukocytes >300k; diagnosis established; cytoreductive plan initiated.
items.details: Rapid leukemic process (Ph+ features later); urgent cytoreduction and transfusion support were indicated.

items.title: Chemotherapy against aggressive leukemia
items.summary: Prolonged systemic chemotherapy to reach CAR‑T eligibility and disease control.
items.details: Escalating/adjusted regimens aimed at bringing leukocytes below CAR‑T threshold; infections managed along the way.

items.title: Systemic shock with paralysis and amnesia
items.summary: Resuscitated; prolonged neurological deficits with gradual recovery.
items.details: Acute collapse required resuscitation. Afterwards: paralysis, memory loss and slowed cognition; stepwise recovery under neurologic guidance.

items.title: Invasive fungal infection with sepsis
items.summary: Severe oropharyngeal focus with systemic involvement; treated successfully.
items.details: Managed in hospital with antimicrobials; concurrent arrhythmias and prior micro‑stroke noted during 2022.

items.title: COVID‑19 pneumonia (ICU, intubation) and GI bleed; recovery
items.summary: Critical COVID‑19 with intubation; GI bleeding; coma; unexpected recovery.
items.details: Rapid pneumonia progression on immunosuppression; post‑ICU recovery followed by stabilization.

items.title: Respiratory arrest (revived) and bacteremia; high‑dose chemo
items.summary: Cardiorespiratory event reversed; rare cardiac‑source bacteremia treated; intensified chemo to reach CAR‑T criteria.
items.details: Therapy escalated to reduce leukocytes below CAR‑T threshold; infections managed.

items.title: CAR‑T cell therapy
items.summary: CAR‑T administered; severe toxicity managed (fever, neurologic and cardiac events).
items.details: High fever, vomiting, transient leg paralysis, cardiac event and profound memory loss consistent with neurotoxicity; gradual recovery thereafter.

items.title: Allogeneic stem‑cell infusion — brother donor
items.summary: Allogeneic stem cells infused as consolidation after CAR‑T.
items.details: Engraftment phase under strict infection control; outpatient recovery thereafter.

items.title: Large abdominal mass; aggressive Hodgkin lymphoma
items.summary: New HL diagnosed, distinct from earlier disease; therapy plan adjusted.
items.details: Considered possibly related to prior immunotherapy background; oncology proposed a new chemotherapy strategy.

items.title: Escalated chemo → septic complication → switch to effective regimen; radiotherapy ×30
items.summary: Initial heavy dose caused sepsis; switched to better‑tolerated regimen; adjuvant radiotherapy (30 sessions).
items.details: After septic episode, regimen adjusted; subsequent cycles showed effect. Radiotherapy added for consolidation (30 daily sessions).

items.title: Severe nasal fracture; surgical rhinoplasty
items.summary: Fall with comminuted nasal fracture → persistent bleeding and obstructed breathing; definitive surgery in November.
items.details: Traumatic fall in late October 2024 caused a multi‑fragment nasal fracture. Ongoing epistaxis and airway obstruction made self‑recovery impossible; a costly rhinoplasty was performed in November to reposition bones and repair soft tissues. Symptoms had also complicated tolerance of high‑intensity chemotherapy until surgery relieved obstruction.

items.title: Rising leukocytes; Ph+ lymphoid cells detected
items.summary: Leukocytes increased from ~35k to ~67k within days; Ph+ lymphoid lineage identified.
items.details: Oncology proposed oral chemotherapy followed by TKI (ponatinib) once stabilized.

items.title: Oral multi‑agent chemotherapy (14 doses)
items.summary: Structured per‑oral regimen at home, total of 14 doses.
items.details: Complex oral combination with interim labs and tolerance monitoring; decision points defined after completion.

items.title: Support and functional recovery
items.summary: Structured supportive care and rehabilitation after the current course.
items.details: Scope and schedule to be adjusted to post‑chemo status and lab dynamics.

items.title: Tyrosine‑kinase inhibitor (ponatinib) — long‑term
items.summary: Initiate TKI maintenance after cytoreduction; likely long‑term or lifelong.
items.details: Start after acceptable hematologic control; monitor response and adverse events; dose optimization expected.

items.title: Potential repeat radiotherapy
items.summary: Consider re‑irradiation if disease control requires it.
items.details: To be discussed by tumor board; depends on imaging and prior dose constraints.

items.title: Possible switch of current chemotherapy protocol
items.summary: Protocol change may be required based on response or toxicity.
items.details: Decision after reassessment of labs, imaging and tolerance; alternative protocol to be selected if indicated.

items.title: Possible additional chemotherapy line
items.summary: Another line may be required depending on disease dynamics.
items.details: To be defined by tumor board after current course evaluation.

items.title: Possible repeat allogeneic stem‑cell transplant
items.summary: Option if disease course necessitates definitive consolidation.
items.details: Contingent on response to TKI and chemo; requires donor/center evaluation and risk–benefit review.

changelog.note: Split 2020 into two blocks: Apr 2020 relapse diagnosis; Apr–Nov 2020 chemo + radiotherapy ×30 with GI bleed/MI. Added persistent header highlight for opened sections (UI change in HTML).
Added October–November 2024 nasal fracture with surgical rhinoplasty (completed). Standardized month names in when_label to full forms.
